page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY ICKORNSHAW
page.content: The hamlet of Ickornshaw is very ancient and its history goes back centuries.The name means"Acorn Wood". The most important building in the hamlet is the {Wesleyan Methodist {Chapel,}which was built in 1875.Many famous people have come to take part in services when special musical performances have been given such as {Handel's"Messiah"}It is now closed. Another interesting house is called Freegate,which is where there used to be a toll-booth.Opposite this used to be the Black Bull Hotel,which is now on the main road.There are two cottages near the beckside which have been lived in for over 200 years.The people who own houses in Ickornshaw have had shooting rights on the local moor for hundreds of years.It is said to be the only moor in England with these rights for householders.
